description: Updates the specified workflow. All deployed systems and system instances that use the workflow will see the changes in the flow when it is redeployed. If you don't want this behavior, copy the workflow (creating a new workflow with a different ID), and update the copy. The workflow can contain only entities in the specified namespace.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the workflow to be updated. The ID should be in the following format. urn:tdm:REGION/ACCOUNT ID/default:workflow:WORKFLOWNAME.

parameters.name: definition
parameters.description: The DefinitionDocument that contains the updated workflow definition. The language used to define the entity. GRAPHQL is the only valid value. The GraphQL text that defines the entity.

nested_params.name: language
nested_params.description: The language used to define the entity. GRAPHQL is the only valid value.

nested_params.name: text
nested_params.description: The GraphQL text that defines the entity.

parameters.name: compatibleNamespaceVersion
parameters.description: The version of the user's namespace. If no value is specified, the latest version is used by default. Use the GetFlowTemplateRevisions if you want to find earlier revisions of the flow to update.

nested_items.name: revisionNumber
nested_items.description: The revision number of the workflow.

nested_items.name: createdAt
nested_items.description: The date when the workflow was created.
